notes: Fifth generation E80. Notable for AE86 RWD sport coupe (4A-GE engine, 1984-1987) - cult classic drift car. FWD models with transverse engines introduced. 1C diesel available. 4A-GE DOHC 16V performance engine in SR5 Sport GT-S. Timing belt service required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Corolla (E80) article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth generation E90. All-new FWD platform. Optional All-Trac 4WD system on sedan and wagon. 4A-FE became standard engine. GT-S model with 4A-GE DOHC engine. Lean-burn 4A-FHE in some markets. Timing belt service required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Corolla (E90) article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh generation E100. Rounded aerodynamic design. North America received 1.6L 4A-FE (105 hp) and 1.8L 7A-FE engines. Available All-Trac 4WD system. AE101 Levin/Trueno performance models with 4A-GE (up to 160 hp 20-valve). Timing belt service required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Corolla (E100) article, January 2025 revision.

Eighth generation E110. North America received 1.8L 1ZZ-FE VVT-i engine (125 hp). New ZZ engine family introduced with variable valve timing. Euro NCAP 3-star crash rating. Timing chain on 1ZZ-FE (no belt service). Some markets retained timing belts on 4A-FE and 7A-FE engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Corolla (E110) article, January 2025 revision.

Ninth generation E120/E130. North America E120 with 1.8L 1ZZ-FE VVT-i (130 hp, 2003-2008). 2008 facelift introduced 2ZR-FE engine and 5-speed automatic. E130 JDM variant. Common D-4 direct injection on some engines. Timing chain on ZZ and ZR engines (no belt service). Euro diesel options with 1CD-FTV and 2AD-FTV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Corolla (E120) and (E130) articles, January 2025 revision.

Tenth generation E140/E150. North America E140 with 1.8L 2ZR-FE (132 hp) or 2.4L 2AZ-FE (158 hp, Matrix). 2011 facelift updated styling. E150 primarily Asia-Pacific markets. Optional CVT transmission. Valvematic variable valve lift on some engines. Timing chain on all engines (no belt service). Common D-4 or D-4S dual injection. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Corolla (E140) and (E150) articles, January 2025 revision.
